alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 18 at 1:52PM PST until February 22 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH EARLY WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 24 inches possible. Winds Monday and Tuesday could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...East Slopes of the Washington Cascades. * WHEN...From Sunday evening through early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will start during the day Sunday primarily above 4000 ft. The bulk of the snow in Snoqualmie Pass and along I-90 is expected to occur Monday night through Wednesday morning. Snow accumulations of 8 to 12 inches possible for elevations less than 3000 feet.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Washington Cascades
